ygData.subject: Re: Versus Of Celerity
ygData.msgSnippet: ... A lot of web sites are wrong.  Most of the stuff on Rokenn s web site is correct because he and I (and others) are actively checking the stuff to make sure
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 16 Nov 1999, Bobby wrote:
>
> I have a question about 36th? song Versus Of Celerity. From what I was told
> and have seen on the web etc this song is only listed as an AGIL buff. Thats
> it.
>
> My question is, is that true? There is no attack speed to it? There is an
> enchanter buff called Celerity which is an upgrade to their attack speed
> spell Alacrity.

A lot of web sites are wrong. Most of the stuff on Rokenn's
web site is correct because he and I (and others) are actively
checking the stuff to make sure it's accurate. Celerity gives
an agi buff (which in turn causes an AC increase), and it
gives a 15% boost to attack speed using:

100 * (1 - new_delay/old_delay)

This is roughly half the enchanter Celerity speedup (which
varies by level, but I haven't noticed any level variance with
our Celerity). AFAIK, all our attack speedups are half the
equivalent-level enchanter speedups. Verant "nerfed" them for
balance reasons by making them singing-only, which typically
halves the effect.

http://rgonzalez.net/EQSongs/

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
